Class Request

java.lang.Object
Request
public class Request
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for storing and parsing user input. Specifically, this class handles a user entered month and year that they want their options to expire in.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Request​(int month, int year, java.lang.String ticker)
    The Constructor takes in a month, year, and ticker.

  • Method Summary

    encode ticker prepares the ticker for the API.

    getEpochTimeStamp converts a Date object into an epoch timestamp, in seconds.
    int getMonth()  
    java.util.Date getThirdFriday()
    getThirdFriday is a method that retrieves the precise Date object corresponding to the third Friday of the month the user is referencing.

    int getYear()

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Request

      public Request​(int month, int year, java.lang.String ticker) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      The Constructor takes in a month, year, and ticker. This is all that is needed for an API request to be made. The Request class handles the rest to ensure a good response back from the API
      Parameters:
      month - an integer representing a month (January is 1, December is 12)
      year - the year which must not be in the past
      ticker - a String representing a ticker.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid month or year is entered

  • Method Details

    • encodeTicker

      public java.lang.String encodeTicker() throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      encode ticker prepares the ticker for the API. It helps prevent potential errors when passing information the request to the API
      Returns:
      a String formatted according to "UTF-8"
      Throws:
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if an encoding error is encountered

    • getThirdFriday

      public java.util.Date getThirdFriday()
      getThirdFriday is a method that retrieves the precise Date object corresponding to the third Friday of the month the user is referencing. The Date is then set to midnight of that day, as required by the API when making requests.
      Returns:
      a Date object for the third Friday of the month and year of this Request object

    • getEpochTimeStamp

      public java.lang.String getEpochTimeStamp()
      getEpochTimeStamp converts a Date object into an epoch timestamp, in seconds. This is the needed format for Dates to be used with the Yahoo Finance API.
      Returns:
      the epoch time stamp, in seconds, for this Request Date object

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()

    • getYear

      public int getYear()

    • getTicker

      public java.lang.String getTicker()
